thread.title: Yulia Skripal to seek political asylum - RIA citing cousin

title: Yulia Skripal to seek political asylum - RIA citing cousin
text:
April 9, 2018 / 4:18 PM / Updated an hour ago Yulia Skripal to seek political asylum - RIA citing cousin Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
MOSCOW (Reuters) - Yulia Skripal, who was poisoned along with her father, ex-spy Sergei Skripal, in Britain, is to seek political asylum, Russia’s RIA news agency reported on Monday, citing a relative. Cameramen capture documents on video after a briefing, attended by representatives of the Russian Prosecutor General's Office and dedicated to investigations and proceedings, including the case of an ex-Russian spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia poisoned in Salisbury, in Moscow, Russia April 9, 2018. REUTERS/Sergei Karpukhin 
“I know that Yulia Skripal’s statement about political asylum is coming already,” her cousin, Viktoria Skripal, said on a Russian TV talk show, according to RIA. Reporting by Maria Tsvetkova; Editing by Christian Lowe
